item.title:
The elf owl (Micrathene whitneyi) is the world's smallest and lightest owl. The mean body weight of this species is 40 g (1.4 oz). These tiny owls are 12.5 to 14.5 cm (4.9 to 5.7 in) long and have a wingspan of about 27 cm
[read more: https://t.co/zaSnOfMPp7] https://t.co/rJ0rqRndLt

item.title: For people with very rare blood types, obtaining lifesaving blood can be extremely hard. There's a blood type, called Rh-null, which is probably the rarest in the world. item.title:
Spain's S-80 submarines were planned to enter service in 2015 but a weight miscalculation delayed them for 8 years. Someone put a decimal point in the wrong place.
Cost overruns to fix that: €2 billions.
One of the most expensive math errors ever: https://t.co/1DkiYn5jsN https://t.co/EOxz6470qy
